page.title: 15West Wratting: Daily Life
page.content: Our interviewee thinks farming is all hustle and bustle these days and from his scullery window, that's certainly how it seems. Tractors, combine harvesters, then grain lorries and next the "sugar beet run"-it certainly seems to be a hive of activity in the farmyard across the road. It's less busy of course in the depths of winter and in January this year, almost everything came to a standstill with the farm and cottages being cut off by snow for the best part of a week. They are very self-sufficient. He takes his wife to work and to the "big" supermarket for late night shopping on Wednesday. They can fill the boot of the car provided by the people for whom he gardens.
